de.stock.tradeable

Interface ITradeable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Commodity, Derivate, Forex, Stock, Tradeable

    public interface ITradeable
    Interface for tradeables

    Tradeables, which are stored in the TradeableHandler, consist of several parts:

    - The value
      Every tradeable has a value at what cost the player can buy one
      The value gets influenced by events respectively environments.
      If a tradeable wasn't influenced by an event the TradeableHandler updates the value manually
      using a random value in between the influencable bottom bound and the influencable top bound of the tradeable every round.

    - The shares
      Every tradeable has a number of minimum and maximum available shares.
      The number of shares is initialized with initializeShares()
      This number varies if the player buys or sells a tradeable.
      (It should change randomly without the players influence, too)

    - The environment
      Every tradeable is part of one or more environments.
      Example: Wheat is part of the Group cereal

    A tradeable is from type Stock, Commodity, Forex or Derivate and a developer must instantiate from these classes.
    He must not instantiate the Tradeable class!

    Its the key element to earn money in this game.
    Author:
    chlange

      • updateValue

        java.lang.Double updateValue()
        Updates value of tradeable according to random
        value in between getInfluenceBottomBound() and setInfluenceTopBound(Double)
        The sign of the value is random, too. (See SIGN_NEGATIVE_BOUND)
        Returns:
        new value of tradeable
